source.title: Sense of agency in the human brain

confidence_rationale: Review-level synthesis supports comparator-based self-attribution after action outcomes, consistent with a pre/post boundary in error interpretation; support is indirect for explicit tokenized routing primitives.

mapping.source_claim_statement: Agency depends on matching intended actions and predicted consequences to observed outcomes.
mapping.ree_translation: Supports REE commit-boundary reclassification from counterfactual evaluation to attributable post-commit feedback.
mapping.mapping_caveat: The source does not prescribe data-structure fields or TTL broadcast semantics for commitment events.
mapping.source_context: Human cognitive neuroscience and action-awareness literature.

confidence_components.notes: Strong conceptual alignment; moderate transfer risk from phenomenology/review evidence to architecture-level implementation contracts.
